tourBios.exmtStatus: Top 8, 1999 SENIOR PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.otherVics: 1973, 1980 and 1991 Tri-State PGA Open. 1977 and 1978 Tri-State PGA Championship. 1977, 1978, 1985, 1993 and 1994 Western PGA Golf Association Championship. 1981 Tri-State PGA Match Play Championship. 1984 Pennsylvania Open. 1988 Pennsylvania State PGA Championship.
tourBios.carHigh: 1998: Made five appearances on the SENIOR TOUR, with his best effort at the U.S. Senior Open...Made national headlines at Riviera CC when he was in second place after 36 holes and eventually finished T22 in the event...Returned to the SENIOR TOUR National Qualifying Tournament at Grenelefe Golf Resort, but failed to earn his card after a T23 performance. 1997: Debuted on the SENIOR TOUR at the Bell Atlantic Classic and was T14 in the rain-shortened event at Chester Valley GC...Also travelled to Europe and finished T12 in The Senior Open Championship...Had a T46 in the National Qualifying Tournament at the TPC at Sawgrass near the end of the season
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Head professional for more than 26 years at Allegheny CC...Was two-time PGA Senior Club Professional of the Year in 1997 and 1998...Selected Tri-State PGA Player of the Year in 1977, 1981, 1985 and 1988, and was the 1994 Tri-State PGA Senior Player of the Year...Named 1989 Tri-State Teacher of the Year...Held the lowest scoring average among Tri-State PGA professionals in 1977, 1981 and 1985.
tourBios.personal: Got started in golf by caddying with his brothers at Lincoln Hills CC in Irwin, PA...Younger brother Michael stayed in the golf business and is currently a master professional at Greensburg CC in Greensburg, PA...Son Brian is a merchandise manager at EPCOT at Disney World...Son Kevin has lettered for three years on the Moon High School golf team, and is its number-one player this year...Lists Arnold Palmer as his hero...Has had two holes-in-one in competition during his career.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 4th on the PGA TOUR Champions 2 times.
